<p>
Project Summary

To transform the science of epidemic intelligence, PIPP is a multi-disciplinary, multi-institutional project seeking to apply the engineering System-of-Systems (SoS) concept to the problem of integrating models across disciplines and scales. This project will introduce a new paradigm (SoS) for infectious disease modeling. Activities of our Phase I project include the development of a “Vision Paper” outlining this idea and providing a blueprint for a Phase II application; six interdisciplinary demonstration projects focusing on Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza (HPAI) and applying SoS thinking to problems at the intersections of biology (BIO), computer science (CISE), social science (SBE), and engineering (ENG); training of undergraduates, graduate students, and a postdoctoral associate; and formation of an advisory board and network of stakeholders for Phase II. Broader impacts of the PIPP include (i) workforce enhancement; (ii) development of innovative and translational modeling approaches that are relevant to various US mission agencies (e.g. USDA, EPA, NIH, and CDC), global organizations (e.g. WHO, FAO, OIE, UN), and nonprofits (e.g. BMGF, Ending Pandemics, Rockefeller Foundation); and (iii) creation of extensible, open-access computer code for generic and project-specific tasks.


</p>
